qas.question: What was the highest Beyonce's first solo recording achieved in the Billboard Hot 100?

context: Beyoncé's first solo recording was a feature on <a5_0><a9_0>Jay Z<a9_0/><a5_0/>'s "'03 Bonnie & Clyde" that was released in October 2002, peaking at <a0_0><a7_0>number <a4_0>four<a7_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/> on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart. Her first solo album <a1_0><a6_0>Dangerously in Love<a6_0/><a1_0/> was released on <a10_0>June 24, 2003<a10_0/>, after Michelle Williams and Kelly Rowland had released their solo efforts. The album sold 317,000 copies in its first week, debuted atop the Billboard 200, and has since sold <a2_0>11 million<a2_0/> copies worldwide. The album's lead single, "<a3_0><a11_0>Crazy in Love<a11_0/><a3_0/>", featuring Jay Z, became Beyoncé's first number-one single as a solo artist in the US. The single "Baby Boy" also reached number one, and singles, "Me, Myself and I" and "Naughty Girl", both reached the top-<a13_0>five.<a13_0/> The album earned Beyoncé a then record-tying five awards at the 46th Annual Grammy Awards; Best Contemporary R&B Album, Best Female R&B Vocal Performance for "Dangerously in Love 2", Best R&B Song and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration for "Crazy in Love", and Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals for "The Closer I Get to You" with <a8_0><a12_0>Luther Vandross<a8_0/>.
